meanings.definition: The right side of a ship when facing forward.
meanings.sent1: The captain stood on the starboarding of the ship, gazing out at the vast ocean.
meanings.sent2: The crew members gathered on the starboarding to watch the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The seagull landed on the starboarding and tried to steal a fish from a sailor's hand.
meanings.sent4: The starboarding of the ship was bathed in golden sunlight as the day came to an end.
meanings.sent5: The waves crashed against the starboarding, creating a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: To turn a ship to the right.
meanings.sent1: The captain decided to starboarding the ship to avoid the storm.
meanings.sent2: The crew worked together to starboarding the vessel towards the safe harbor.
meanings.sent3: The ship began to starboarding slowly, following the captain's orders.
meanings.sent4: With a steady hand on the wheel, the sailor started to starboarding the ship.
meanings.sent5: The wind helped to starboarding the ship smoothly through the calm waters.

meanings.definition: A person who is on the right side of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The starboarding waved to the passengers on the shore as the ship departed.
meanings.sent2: The captain's loyal assistant always stood on the starboarding during voyages.
meanings.sent3: The young sailor felt proud to be assigned to the starboarding of the ship.
meanings.sent4: The starboarding guided the new crew members on their duties with a friendly smile.
meanings.sent5: The experienced seaman shared stories with the starboarding about life at sea.
